sense.name: attempt to move something in a particular direction through force
sense.commentary: Includes: PUSH AWAY, PUSH BACK, PUSH DOWN, PUSH UP
sense.examples: She pushed him away and said, "Leave me alone." They pushed back the opposing forces. I pushed him down as the bullets sailed over our heads. They pushed up on the hatch until it popped open.

sense.name: erupt, obtrude
sense.examples: His hair pushed out from under his hat. The tooth finally pushed through the gums.

sense.name: move oneself forward
sense.examples: She pushed forward until she was at the front of the crowd. "Goodbye," said Pooh and Piglet for the last time, and they pushed on to Owl's house.

sense.name: PUSH AROUND--bully, boss around
sense.examples: Her brother was always pushing her around.

sense.name: PUSH ASIDE--dismiss, bar from attention
sense.examples: Physics is too important to be pushed aside.
